title: Data Import
subtitle: Guided interface to import your ecological data

overview.description: Niamoto organizes your ecological data around observations (occurrences). This guided interface will walk you through the import process step by step.

howItWorks.title: How does Niamoto work?
howItWorks.subtitle: Understanding the data flow to better organize your imports

keyPoint.title: Key point:
keyPoint.description: Taxonomy is automatically extracted from your occurrences. You don't need to import it separately!

plots.title: Plots
plots.description: Spatial groupings: parcels, localities, study sites

step1.title: Import occurrences
step1.description: Load your CSV file and configure column mapping. Taxonomy will be extracted automatically.

step2.title: Spatial aggregations
step2.description: Add plots or shapes to group your data and generate statistics by area.

step3.title: Verification and import
step3.description: Review your data summary and start the import. Statistics will be generated automatically.

occurrences.title: Observation data
occurrences.description: Import your occurrences file. Taxonomy will be extracted automatically.

file.title: File loading
file.description: Select your CSV file containing observation data

requiredFields.title: Required fields
requiredFields.description: These fields are necessary to identify and locate your observations
requiredFields.note: Map only essential fields. Taxonomic hierarchy configuration will be done in the next step.

taxonomy.title: Automatic taxonomy extraction
taxonomy.description: Configure the taxonomic hierarchy. Niamoto will automatically extract unique taxa from your data according to this configuration.
taxonomy.extractionNote: Complete taxonomy will be extracted during import following this hierarchy.

enrichment.title: External API enrichment
enrichment.description: Optional: Enrich your taxonomy with data from external APIs (conservation status, endemism, images, etc.)
enrichment.note: API enrichment is optional. You can proceed to the next step (Spatial aggregations) using the "Next" button at the bottom of the main page.

aggregations.title: Spatial aggregations (optional)
aggregations.description: Add spatial groupings to organize and analyze your data
aggregations.info: Aggregations allow you to group your data by geographic areas and generate statistics by grouping.

shapes.title: Geographic zones (shapes)
shapes.description: Import shape files to group by geographic areas
shapes.noShapes: No shapes configured. Click "Add shape" to start.

summary.title: Import summary
summary.description: Review information before starting the import

occurrences.title: Import occurrences
occurrences.description: Loading observation data and automatic taxonomy extraction

plots.title: Import plots
plots.description: Creating spatial groupings and linking with occurrences

shapes.title: Import shapes
shapes.description: Loading geographic zones for spatial analysis

summary.warning: Once the import is started, the process may take a few minutes depending on your data size. Do not close this window during import.

fieldMapping.title: Map Fields
fieldMapping.dragInstruction: Drag columns from your file to the required fields, or click to select.
fieldMapping.fieldsFromOccurrences: Fields detected from the imported occurrences file
fieldMapping.mustExistInOccurrences: This field must exist in your occurrences file when importing

taxonomyHierarchy.title: Taxonomy Hierarchy Configuration
taxonomyHierarchy.description: Define the hierarchical levels and map them to columns in your file
taxonomyHierarchy.instruction: Define taxonomy levels from most general (e.g., family) to most specific (e.g., subspecies). At least the first two levels must be mapped to columns.
taxonomyHierarchy.mapAtLeastTwoLevels: Please map at least the first two levels to columns in your file.

connection.title: API Connection
connection.description: Configure the API endpoint and test the connection
connection.queryFieldDescription: The parameter name used to send the taxon name to the API

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: Configure how to authenticate with the API

fieldMapping.title: Response Field Mapping
fieldMapping.description: Map API response fields to Niamoto database fields
fieldMapping.availableFields: Available fields detected from API test. Click to add to mapping.
fieldMapping.commonFields: Common Niamoto fields you might want to map:

plotHierarchy.title: Plot Hierarchy Configuration
plotHierarchy.description: Configure hierarchical relationships between plots, localities, and countries
plotHierarchy.enableDescription: Create a nested structure of plots within localities and countries
plotHierarchy.levelsDescription: Define levels from highest to lowest (e.g., country → locality → plot)
plotHierarchy.selectColumnForLevel: Select a column for hierarchy level
plotHierarchy.aggregateDescription: Combine geometries of child plots for parent levels
plotHierarchy.parentGeometriesNote: Parent geometries will be automatically calculated from their children.
